page.title: 07Lydford School
page.content: The school stands in the middle of West Lydford village and serves East and West Lydford,Lydford on Fosse and the area around the Fosse Way. There are 59 children with 2 full time teachers busily engaged in learning activities from the 3 Rs to sport,music,drama,craft work and country dancing. School and church work very closely together and parents come in to help with sewing and weekly swimming outings to Strode Pool in nearby Street.Parents also do odd jobs around the school. Schooling began in West Lydford in 1731 when Â£7 was left by Thomas Pope for the education of six poor children.In 1870 a school house was made from a cottage next to the church but in 1874 the present school was built.
